name: Mark Statman
bio: Mark Statman is the author of four poetry collections, most recently That Train Again (2015) and A Map of the Winds (2013). He is the translator of Black Tulips: The Selected Poems of José María Hinojosa (2012) and Never Made in America: Selected Poems of Martín Barea Mattos (2017), and cotranslator of Garcia Lorca’s  Poet in New York (2007, with Pablo Medina). Statman has also written extensively on teaching creative writing, including Listener in the Snow: The Practice and Teaching of Poetry (2000) and The Alphabet of the Trees: A Guide to Nature Writing (2007, with Christian McEwen).
